coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1GettingStarted-Hint: Essential settings to get started with Coffee Pub Blacksmith
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH4Introduction-Hint: The Blacksmith Module serves as the foundational framework for the entire Coffee Pub module series, providing essential services and shared functionality that all other modules depend upon. While powerful as a standalone module with features like enhanced combat statistics, customizable UI elements, and comprehensive token management, its true potential is realized when integrated with the complete Coffee Pub suite, where it orchestrates seamless communication and synchronization between all modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2CoffeePubSuite-Hint: Information about installed Coffee Pub modules
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2DefaultPartySettings-Hint: Default settings for party creation and management
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultPartyName-Hint: The default party name to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultPartySize-Hint: The default party size to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultPartyMakeup-Hint: The default party makeup to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultPartyLevel-Hint: The default party level to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultRulebooks-Hint: A comma separated list of default rule books to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1LayoutAndExperience-Hint: Customize the layout and experience of the Coffee Pub suite of modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2Themes-Hint: Enable or disable the themes you'd like to use in the Coffee Pub suite of modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2FoundryEnhancements-Hint: Enhancements and improvements to FoundryVTT's interface and functionality
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3QualityOfLife-Hint: Quality of life improvements and user experience enhancements
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3CanvasTools-Hint: Control which bits of the interface hide and show when toggled.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.canvasToolsHideLeftUI-Hint: When enabled, the left side of the interface, including the branding, toolbar, and player list will be hidden when the toggle is activated. Be warned, if other modules have added items to this area, they will also be hidden.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.canvasToolsHideBottomUI-Hint: When enabled, the bottom of the interface, including the macrobar, will be hidden when the toggle is activated. Be warned, if other modules have added items to this area, they will also be hidden.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3menubar-Hint: Settings for the menubar that appears at the top of foundry's interface.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableMenubar-Hint: Show the slim Blacksmith Menubar at the top of the foundry interface. Required for many of the tools and features of blacksmit including combat enhancements.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.excludedUsersMenubar-Hint: List of userIDs that should not see the menubar. (comma-separated)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.objectLinkStyle-Hint: Styling for object links in chat and journals
coffee-pub-blacksmith.hideRollTableIcon-Hint: Hide the roll table icon in the interface
coffee-pub-blacksmith.titlebarTextSize-Hint: Size of text in window titlebars
coffee-pub-blacksmith.titlebarIconSize-Hint: Size of icons in window titlebars
coffee-pub-blacksmith.titlebarSpacing-Hint: Changes the spacing between the elements in the titlebar of windows. This change applies to all foundry module windows with titlebar icons. If other modules are changing titlebars, this could result in odd titlebar behaviors. Range: 0px to 25px. Default: 0px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3JournalTools-Hint: Tools for upgrading actor and item links to compendium references.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableJournalTools-Hint: Add a Tools icon to journal windows for upgrading actor and item links to compendium references.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableJournalDoubleClick-Hint: Enable double-click to open journal entries
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1RunTheGame-Hint: Settings for running games, toolbars, chat, and gameplay features
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2TokenImageReplacementActions-Hi: Automation of token actions. This include token changes for when a character dies, is targeted, has the current turn in combat, etc.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.turnIndicatorCurrentBorderColor-Hint: Enter a hex color code for the border color of the turn indicator.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.turnIndicatorCurrentBackgroundColor-Hint: Enter a hex color code for the background color of the turn indicator.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1ManageContent-Hint: Tools for managing tokens, images, and content
coffee-pub-blacksmith.numCompendiums-Hint: Sets how many compendium priority slots are available for each type (Actor, Item, Feature, Spell). Changing this value requires a reload to take effect.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2CompendiumMapping-Hint: When we automate searching for things, we look in the compendiums first. This is where we will look for a match. They are in priority order and we stop looking when we find a match.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.searchWorldFirst-Hint: When enabled, will search for matches in the world before looking in compendiums. When disabled, will only search in the selected compendiums.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.searchWorldLast-Hint: When enabled, will search for for matches in the world after looking in compendiums if no results are found. When disabled, will not search world as a fallback.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1RollingAndProgression-Hint: Roll systems, XP distribution, and character progression
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1Automation-Hint: These setting add features like token image replacement, movement tools, and more.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2Tokens-Hint: Blacksmith can autmatically change the name of a dropped token, change the token image, change the style of the nameplate under the token, rotate a token, add sound to a token and many more things.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenRotationOptions-Hint: Configure the options for token rotation on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableTokenRotation-Hint: Automatically rotate tokens to face the direction they move. Tokens with 'Lock Rotation' enabled will not be affected.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenRotationMinDistance-Hint: Minimum distance a token must move (in grid units) before it rotates to face the movement direction. Prevents tiny adjustments from causing unwanted rotation.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenRotationMode-Hint: Dertrmines which tokens should automatically face their movement direction.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenMovementOptions-Hint: Configure the options for token movement on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementType-Hint: The current movement restriction type for all players
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementFollowDistanceThreshold-Hint: The number of tiles a token can be from the leader before it is considered too far away to be included in the Conga or Follow marching order. A best practice is to at least have as many tiles as the number of party tokens on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenSpacing-Hint: Number of grid spaces to maintain between tokens in formation
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenMovementSounds-Hint: Configure audio feedback for token movement on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundsEnabled-Hint: Play audio feedback when tokens are moved on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundPlayer-Hint: Sound to play when player tokens are moved.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundMonster-Hint: Sound to play when monster/NPC tokens are moved.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundVolume-Hint: Volume level for movement sounds (0.0 = silent, 1.0 = full volume).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundDistanceThreshold-Hint: Minimum distance in feet that a token must move to trigger a sound (1-50 feet).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2DroppedTokens-Hint: Configure the options for dropped tokens on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.unlockTokenRotation-Hint: Override Foundry's default 'lock rotation' setting for all new tokens. This will allow tokens to be rotated freely.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.disableTokenRing-Hint: Override Foundry's default 'enable ring' setting for all new tokens. This will disable the dynamic token ring display. Note: This setting only affects Foundry's ring system and will not remove rings that are part of the token image itself.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.setTokenScale-Hint: Set the default scale size for dropped tokens.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenNameFormat-Hint: Choose the format of token renaming so they read how you want them.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.ignoredTokens-Hint: Add any token names you want ignored when renaming tokens, separated by commas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.fuzzyMatch-Hint: If checked, if any part of the token contains the word it will be ignored. If unchecked, and exact match is required to ignore the token.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenNameTable-Hint: If using a random name from a table, select the table that should be used to rename the token.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateFontSize-Hint: Sets the fontsize for nameplates under tokens. Range: 5px to 70px. Default: 24px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateFontFamily-Hint: Sets the font for nameplates under tokens. Default: Signika.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateColor-Hint: Sets the font color for nameplates under tokens. Default: #FFFFFF.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateOutlineSize-Hint: Sets the outline size for nameplates under tokens. Default: 2px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateOutlineColor-Hint: Sets the outline color for nameplates under tokens. Default: #111111.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementEnabled-Hint: Enable the image replacement features and functions.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementShowInCoffeePubTool: Show the Token Image Replacement button in the CoffeePub toolbar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementShowInFoundryToolba: Show the Token Image Replacement button in the FoundryVTT native toolbar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementUpdateDropped-Hint: Automatically update token images when tokens are dropped on the canvas. When disabled, only manual updates via the Image Replacements window will work. This feature is also available in the Image Replacements window.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementThreshold-Hint: How strict the matching algorithm should be. Lower values = more fuzzy matching, higher values = more exact matching.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementSkipLinked-Hint: Do not replace images for tokens linked to actors (usually player characters).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2TokenImageReplacementCache-Hint: The cache is where we store the image references that are used for token image replacement. It also contains the tags, cateogries and other metadata for the images.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementPath-Hint: Base folder path for replacement images. For user data folders, use 'data/rest-of-folder-path'. For core modules, use 'modules/module-name/rest-of-folder-path'. The path should be relative to Foundry's root directory.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementIgnoredFolders-Hint: Comma-separated list of folder names to ignore when scanning for token images. These folders will be completely skipped during the scan process. Examples: _gsdata_, .DS_Store
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementAutoUpdate-Hint: Automatically scan for new or changed token images when changes are detected.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementDeprioritizedWords-: Comma-separated list of words that should reduce the match score of images containing them. Use this to prefer base creature types over specialized variants (e.g., 'spirit,ghost,undead,shadow').
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementIgnoredWords-Hint: Comma-separated list of patterns to completely exclude files from cache. Supports wildcards: 'spirit' (exact), '*spirit' (ends with), 'spirit*' (starts with), '*spirit*' (contains), '*.png' (extension). Files matching any pattern will not be scanned or cached.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementCategoryStyle-Hint: Choose how category filters are displayed in the Token Image Replacement window. Buttons show as clickable buttons, Tabs show as traditional tab interface.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementTagSortMode-Hint: How to sort and display tags: Count (by frequency), Alpha (alphabetical), or Hidden (hide tags completely)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementFuzzySearch-Hint: When enabled, searches for individual words independently. When disabled, searches for exact string matches.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenImageReplacementDataWeight: Configure the weights for the data used to calculate the best match for a token image replacement. These weights are used to determine the importance of the data when calculating the best match for a token image replacement.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementWeightActorName-Hin: Weight the actor name field with the highest priority when calculating the best match for a token image replacement. (e.g., 'Frost Giant', 'Goblin')
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementWeightTokenName-Hin: Weight the token name field with the highest priority when calculating the best match for a token image replacement. (e.g., 'Bob (Goblin)', 'Goblin 1', 'Bob')
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementWeightRepresentedAc: Weight the represented actor field with the highest priority when calculating the best match for a token image replacement. (e.g., 'Bob (Goblin)', 'Goblin 1', 'Bob')
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementWeightCreatureType-: Weight the creature type field with the highest priority when calculating the best match for a token image replacement. (e.g., 'Humanoid', 'Dragon', 'Beast') - Official D&D5e type
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementWeightCreatureSubty: Weight the creature subtype field with the highest priority when calculating the best match for a token image replacement. (e.g., 'Goblinoid', 'Orc', 'Elf') - Official D&D5e subtype
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementWeightEquipment-Hin: Weight the equipment field with the highest priority when calculating the best match for a token image replacement. (e.g., 'Sword', 'Bow', 'Staff')
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementWeightSize-Hint: Weight the size field with the highest priority when calculating the best match for a token image replacement. (e.g., 'Large', 'Medium', 'Huge')
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3JournalEncounterToolbar-Hint: Automated encounter settings for journal entries.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableJournalEncounterToolbar-Hint: Shows a toolbar in journal entries with potential encounter data that provides tools for deploying monsters, rolling initiative, and creating combat encounters.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableEncounterContentScanning-Hint: Scan journal content for encounter data in JSON, markdown, or plain text formats when structured data is not found.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableJournalEncounterToolbarRealTimeUpd: Automatically update monster and party CR values in encounter toolbars when tokens are added, moved, or removed from the canvas. Disable if you experience performance issues.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterToolbarDeploymentPattern-Hint: Choose how monsters should be arranged when deployed from an encounter journal entry.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.toggleVisibility-Hint: Toggle the visibility of all tokens on the canvas. If any tokens are hidden, this will make them visible. If all tokens are visible, this will hide them all.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1ArtificialIntelligence-Hint: If you want to leverage Blacksmith tools like Ask the Regent, you'll need to set up an OpenAI account and API key.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIMacro-Hint: The name of the macro that should trigger the AI window if you want one in addition to the Ask the Regent button in the toolbar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIAPIKey-Hint: API key from OpenAI. Get yours at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys .
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIProjectId-Hint: Optional: OpenAI Project ID for better cost tracking and team management. Get yours at https://platform.openai.com/projects
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIModel-Hint: Version of the OpenAI model to use. GPT-4 Turbo is recommended for D&D content but costs more. Free accounts can use GPT-3.5 Turbo.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIGameSystems-Hint: Optimize logic for the game system. Includes a default prompt that can be overridden below.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIPrompt-Hint: Overrides prompt for the game system above. Edit the prompt to customize or refine OpenAI behavior.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIContextLength-Hint: Number of messages, including replies, OpenAI has access to. Increases API usage cost. Context is not shared among users and resets on page reload.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAITemperature-Hint: Controls randomness in responses (0-2). Higher values make output more creative but less focused. Default: 1
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1DeveloperTools-Hint: Debug settings, console options, and developer tools
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cssTransition-Hint: Ease the new css styles into place with a smooth transition
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cssDarkMode-Hint: Enable dark mode for the css editor
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3PerformanceMenubarOptions-Hint: Show performance tools in the menubar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarShowSettings-Hint: Show the settings tool in the menubar left zone.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarShowRefresh-Hint: Show the refresh tool in the menubar left zone.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarShowPerformance-Hint: Show the performance monitor tool in the menubar left zone.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarPerformancePollInterval-Hint: The interval in seconds between performance monitor data updates. Default: 5 seconds. (5 to 300 seconds)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3Latency-Hint: Settings related to the system latency between players and the server.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableLatency-Hint: If checked, the system latency will be checked and displayed in the system list.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.latencyCheckInterval-Hint: The interval in seconds between latency checks. Default: 30 seconds. (0 to disable)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.globalFancyConsole-Hint: You love sunshine and lollipops. Display console messages in rich colors... not that you should ever have to see them. Default: On (checked).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.globalDebugMode-Hint: Log errors to the console and notification system as appropriate. Make the console bleed. Default: Off (unchecked).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.globalConsoleDebugStyle-Hint: Looking for debug code? You have to ask yourself if you use the console to solve problems or if you enjoy a good word-search puzzle. Default: Fancy Pants.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultCardTheme-Hint: This theme will be used as the default theme unless you override it in the other coffee pub modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.chatSpacing-Hint: Increases the gap between chat messages. Applies to all messages, no just this module. Range: -20px to 60px. Default: 3px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardTopMargin-Hint: Increses or decreases the top margin of the chat. This is useful if other module add items like tokens or text into the chat that changes the default layout. This offset only applies to Coffee Pub modules. Range: -20px to 20px. Default: 0px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardBottomMargin-Hint: Increses or decreases the bottom margin of the chat. This is useful if other module add items like tokens or text into the chat that changes the default layout. This offset only applies to Coffee Pub modules. Range: -20px to 20px. Default: 0px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardLeftMargin-Hint: Increses or decreases the left margin of the chat. This is useful if other module add items like tokens or text into the chat that changes the default layout. This offset only applies to Coffee Pub modules. Range: -20px to 20px. Default: 0px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardRightMargin-Hint: Increses or decreases the right margin of the chat. This is useful if other module add items like tokens or text into the chat that changes the default layout. This offset only applies to Coffee Pub modules. Range: -20px to 20px. Default: 0px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardTopOffset-Hint: Adds additional top margin for some cards. And example would be scribe chat narration cards. This offset only applies to Coffee Pub modules. Range: -80px to 80px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2diceRollTool-Hint: Configure the unified roll system and its integrations with other modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.diceRollToolSystem-Hint: Set the system you wish to use when rolling from the chat card.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3diceRollToolIntegrations-Hint: Blacksmit Dice Rolls and work with some other modules. Selecte the modules you wish to leverage. (They must be installed and enabled.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.diceRollToolEnableDiceSoNice-Hint: Use Dice So Nice for animated dice rolls.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableSceneInteractions-Hint: Adds icons to the scene title letting you knwo which is active and which is being viewed. Defualt: Enabled (checked).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableSceneClickBehaviors-Hint: Change the default mouse behaviors on the Scene Directory. Left-click: View Scene, Double-click: Activate Scene, and Shift-Left-click: Open up the scene configuration window. Defualt: Enabled (checked).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.sceneTextAlign-Hint: Sets the alignment of the titles in the scene selector.  Defualt: Center.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.sceneFontSize-Hint: Sets the font size for the scene titles in the scene selector.  Defualt: 1.0em.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterToolbarDeploymentHidden-Hint: If checked, deployed tokens will be hidden by default.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultNarrativeFolder-Hint: The folder that should be used when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultJournalPageTitle-Hint: Optional: The title that should be used when creating new journal pages.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultSceneLocation-Hint: LOCATION > Parent > Environtment > Area. The location that should be used when creating new scenes. (Optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultSceneParent-Hint: Location > PARENT > Environtment > Area. The parent that should be used when creating new scenes. This would be the larger collection of scenes. e.g. Mines of Tethyamar, Castle of the White Dragon, etc. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultSceneEnvironment-Hint: LOCATION > Parent > ENVIRONMENT> Area. The kind of environment that should be used when creating the narrative.. e.g. Forest, Crypt, Dungeon, etc. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultSceneArea-Hint: Location > Parent > Environtment > AREA.  The area that should be used when creating new scenes. e.g. Chasmfall Castle, Old House, Goblin Cave, etc. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeUseCookies-Hint: If checked, the system will first attempt to pull data from cookies before using defaults.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cookiesRememberCardStates-Hint: If enabled, the collapsed/expanded state of cards will be remembered between sessions using cookies.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeDefaultCardImage-Hint: Select the default image option for new narrative cards.  (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeDefaultImagePath-Hint: The default path to use for custom images in narrative cards. Used if 'custom' is selected above. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeDefaultIncludeEncounter-Hint: If checked, new narratives will include an encounter section by default.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeDefaultIncludeTreasure-Hint: If checked, new narratives will include a treasure section by default.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeDefaultXP-Hint: The default XP value to use in new narratives. Use 'None' or a number (e.g., '3600 XP'). (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeDefaultTreasureDetails-Hint: The default treasure description to use in new narratives. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeDefaultEncounterDetails-Hint: The default encounter description to use in new narratives. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3EncounterDefaults-Hint: These settings control default values for encounter templates.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultEncounterFolder-Hint: The folder that should be used when creating new encounters.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterDefaultCardImage-Hint: Select the default image option for new encounter cards. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterDefaultImagePath-Hint: The default path to use for custom images in encounter cards. Used if 'custom' is selected above. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2XpDistribution-Hint: These settings control the automatic XP distribution system that triggers when combat ends.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableXpDistribution-Hint: When enabled, automatically show XP distribution window when combat ends
coffee-pub-blacksmith.autoDistributeXp-Hint: When enabled, automatically distribute XP without showing the distribution window
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpCalculationMethod-Hint: Choose the method for calculating XP from monster CR
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpMultiplierDefeated-Hint: XP multiplier for defeated monsters (1.0 = full XP)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpMultiplierNegotiated-Hint: XP multiplier for negotiated monsters (1.0 = full XP)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpMultiplierFled-Hint: XP multiplier for monsters that fled (0.5 = half XP)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpMultiplierBypassed-Hint: XP multiplier for bypassed monsters (0.0 = no XP)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpMultiplierCaptured-Hint: XP multiplier for captured monsters (1.0 = full XP)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpPartySizeHandling-Hint: How to handle XP distribution with varying party sizes
coffee-pub-blacksmith.shareXpResults-Hint: If enabled, XP distribution results will be shared to all players. If disabled, only the GM will see them.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableEnhancedImageGuessing-Hint: Uses comprehensive synonym mapping to automatically select appropriate images for imported items based on their names and descriptions.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.imageGuessingDebugMode-Hint: Shows detailed console logs about how images are selected for imported items. Useful for troubleshooting and understanding the matching process.
